Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Efebee
Reviews.Content: This 3 star hotel on La Ramblas has got everything you need , clean rooms, helpful staff ,perfect location. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “clean but not a great area”
Reviews.Author: dilleaf
Reviews.Content: Sited at the sea end of La Rambla this hotel is OKish. The room was adequate for a few days and cleaned daily, beds not overly comfortlable, window letting in little natural light. Staff were OK. Area not the greatest, especially in the evening. However it's a bed for the night and most of your time will probaby be spent out and about. It would not be my choice if I visited Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for busy city break in Barcelona centre.”
Reviews.Author: ADJHarris
Reviews.Content: Good clean and central hotel with friendly staff which is just what's needed for a city break. Basic room, perfect for the occasion. We didn't use the breakfast facility in hotel as so many yummy restaurants and cafes to choose from around the hotel. Prompt response from staff when I asked for extras pillows which they kindly sorted out. I will 100% stay here again next time I visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Narrow beds”
Reviews.Author: Oddmund L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central. Narrow double beds and paper walls between rooms. Good for a short period of some days,

Reviews.Title: “Very poor rooms, no aircon”
Reviews.Author: Lina S
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I stayed there for 3 days during a business visit. Our Spanish colleagues have booked us the hotel and when we arrived we were told that we were upgraded for free to a superior room. The room was awful !!! no air circulation and no aircon because "we were mid-season". The bed cover was also dirty although the room was relatively clean. Breakfast was good, though. Indeed a great location but heavily noisy - my colleague hasn't slept at all the 2nd day. When we asked for an ugrade (to pay) receptionist's attitude was very arrogant. I told her that we would leave and then she decided to give us a discount to upgrade for both rooms. Some staff were polite and helpful but 1-2 receptionists were annoyingly arrogant and careless. Do not recommend for more than a day's stay

Reviews.Title: “hot smelly room”
Reviews.Author: foodielou
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Barcelona - but from reading we gathered that the La Rambla district was the preferred district to visit. Before I get to the review of the Hotel Arc La Rambla - let me say - the La Rambla area is real "cheesy". The restaurants have pre-made food that sits for hours. The stroll area is super-hype - and classless. And so onto the hotel review. Upon check in the staff was friendly and efficient. But when we entered our room ... OMG... what were they using to clean the place .. the worst smelling cleaning solution you could imagine. It stunk! It burned our eyes. The room was just large enough to fit a small double bed with barely enough room for 2 persons to stand in. The room was really warm and yet the climate control did not work. When we went downstairs to the front desk we were told that the climate control (the air conditioning system) had been turned off because about a week before they had a few chilly nights. And they had no intention of turning the A/C back on. They said, "open the window". When we asked for another room they didn't have anything available but "would let us know" if we could move. So that night, we opened the window, but when looking outside the window ..it was like looking down an elevator shaft. There was no way we were going to get any fresh air. also, because the window opened INTO the room - we had to have the curtain pulled back. Not having a curtain for privacy - all the lights from the hallway lit up our two sleeping bodies for all the guests to see as they left the elevator and walked along the hallway. Unbelievable!! There was no fresh air - it was like sleeping in a coffin- a hard coffin at that as the bed was extremely hard. It was disgusting. We were originally going to stay 5 nights - but couldn't get out of there fast enough. We left after 3 nights and couldn't get out of Barcelona fast enough either.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: classybird_10
Reviews.Content: This is a v good hotel. Perfect for a few days sightseeing. Rooms big enough, comfy beds , no noise from the very busy Las Ramblas at night as we had a back room. Breakfast was good. Staff friendly and helpful, good big lockers when we checked out so we didn't need to worry about luggage on our last day. Fantastic location. Walking distance for most attractions and amazing shops, including the beach. Roof terrace lovely and cool after a hot day on the city streets. Took the bus tour which was also brill. Good value hotel. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SaffronButtercup
Reviews.Content: Great location right on Las Ramblas. Room was fine, we were on the fourth floor, although I would say that the storage in the room was poor, not a big deal but as we were staying for a number of nights it would have been nice to have somewhere to put small items of clothing. We had a window in the bedroom which opened, but we could not see out of it as there was some sort of partition behind it. Beds were very firm which I thought would be a problem, however after having the spent the day on our feet sight seeing, we slept very well. Breakfast was not included when we booked the room, so the first morning we tried the breakfast, it was ok, not much value for money, therefore the following mornings we just had a later breakfast while out sight seeing. Staff were very helpful and provided great information about various tours etc. To conclude, this was a perfect hotel for us as we were up early in the morning and only returned in the evenings, therefore we spent very little time in the room. If it was luxury you were after I would suggest looking elsewhere, but if you are like ourselves and more interested in sight seeing, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location; thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfectly situated at the bottom end of La Rambla. It was ideal for bars, restaurants, metro and sight seeing. It was not so good after about 10.00pm The street was walked by homeless beggars and some ladies of the night. The rooms were very clean and modern except from the bathroom which was a bit dated. The walls were extremely thin which meant an uneasy sleep listening to the party goers next door. The beds were also a bit hard but all in all a good trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: RuiJorge
Reviews.Content: Hotel is right on the rambla, we were lucky to have a front room with the window right onto the rambla. Although there are many room which I´m sure have a totally different view or hardly any view at all. Rooms are small even for European standards as well as basic. Our front room was noisy throughout the night, so if you intend to rest think twice... Children are free but they then charge you €5.00 for breakfast. Keeping your luggage after check out is also charged. Overall a pleasant hotel close to all the major attractions but there are better value for money hotels in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Cheap and great location”
Reviews.Author: SVRDave
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the 8th February for a 4 night stay at the hotel leaving on the 12th. The hotel is in a very good location on the bottom of las ramblas absolutely perfect for sight seeing and further traveling as the metro stop is literally around the corner. On check in we were allocated a twin room on the 4th floor, the room was very clean and modern (the bathroom was a bit dated) The bed was a little hard following a long day sightseeing, but had all ammenities which I was expecting, (a kettle and a fridge would have been beneficial). The breakfast buffet was extremely good and there was always plenty there to eat. There is a sex shop nearby and numerous ladies of the night hang round at night offering sex and drugs however were no problems. All the staff were very friendly and helpful and always said hello when you walked in. The only downside with the hotel was the noise, especially on a Friday and Saturday night there was noise from the streets and the metro that ran under the hotel but as it is in a city center location i guess it is to be expected. We really enjoyed our trip and would recommend the hotel for its ease of access to all tourist points as well as the staff, cleanliness and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Situated on the Rambla, street life included”
Reviews.Author: SanneSkov
Reviews.Content: We had a room facing the Rambla with a small balcony. Great for people-watching and feeling the vibe of the street. Not too noisy, if you close the windows. Late in the evening the street gets filled with ladies looking for a catch, but it didnt bother us. We didnt feel unsafe at any time. Room was good value, the bathroom large and clean. Staff very friendly. The breakfast buffet is definitely good value for your money and saves you the time wandering about looking for a local cafe. We didnt succeed in finding that little cozy local breakfast place around the corner, we all wish for.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: salmonpg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on the La Rambla -where the action is. The staff were very helpful and professional; the room was not large but adequate for 2 of us and was very clean. We had a small balcony overlooking the La Rambla and it was a lot of fun watching all the action. And it wasn't as noisy as we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, clean rooms, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: emmajay85
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel could not be better, it is literally 3 mins walk from the Dressanes Metro stop and the port, walk in the opposite direction up La Rambla and your at Catalunya Square. Yes there is a sex shop two shops away, but this is no different than having an Ann Summers next door to your hotel, only difference is there are some prostitutes there at the night time, one did approach my partner but soon as she saw me she was apologetic and walked away, but, to be fair, youll get this in ANY city, they didnt cause any problems or noise late at night. Your not going to get a hotel this good and cheap with a location as good as this, the rooms were very modern and the balcony looked out onto La Rambla, the room was clean and fairly large with a safe, hairdryer and ironing board on request. Only thing i will say is that a gentleman called Daniel on the front desk was quite rude when i was asking how do i get to a service caxia machine to print some Nou Camp tickets, i think this may have been due to a language barrier but the other lady on the front desk took over and she was very helpful. Only complaint i have! We didnt eat breakfast or dinner there so i cant comment on the food, but there are plenty od restaurants and bars nearby, i would reccomend going down to the port for drinks and food as the views are lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - recommended”
Reviews.Author: Dmens
Reviews.Content: A great hotel - family of 4 from Australia with 2 teenage boys and were very happy. Perfect location, superbly clean and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Better alternative to a hostal”
Reviews.Author: Carlos M
Reviews.Content: The service at the Arc is ten times better than many we've come across. Not only were we able to get accommodation here at short notice, but it was at an affordable price. The gentlemen at the front desk was always helpful making excellent recommendations to local restaurants and making taxi arrangements for us upon our departure. The hostal we had checked in to told us "we cannot make recommendations to restaurants." The rooms (based on a standard room) are clean, although they are equipped with tiny showers and an lemon scented air freshener that is so STRONG it's best to always keep the bathroom door closed just to minimize it. It definitely made the stay a bit difficult to tolerate. The flooring is all tile and the rooms do come with a television and free wi-fi in the room (both were things that the hostal DID NOT have unless you want to count their common area). Our stay was comfortable considering it was just a place to relax and sleep after a full day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, more hostel than hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angelique137
Reviews.Content: We booked five nights at this hotel for two couples to celebrate New year and explore some of Barcelona. Like other reviewers, I agree the location was superb, right on La Rambla - a tad too noisy for sleep until the not so small hours most nights we were there, with revellers partying very late. The rooms were very basic, comfortable beds but very short on hanging/drawer/storage space, with only one plastic garden type chair, so sitting on the small balcony to people watch was not really an option. The bedroom lighting is very dim, an uplighter with small bulb for bedside light and only one small ceiling light, making dressing, other than in daytime rather awkward. Also, the only mirror was in the bathroom - don't people care what they look like when they go out and about? Breakfast is 10 euros each day unless you stay and indulge for more than two days, when the price is reduced to 8.50 euros daily. A reasonable buffet is presented and the price is probably about in keeping with the elevated restaurant prices to be found in most tourist places in Barcelona. Reception staff are friendly and reasonably knowledgeable about tourist attractions. We booked through Hotels.Com and, at the booking stage, understood we had paid a price which included breakfast, however, this wasn't endorsed on the paperwork and as we were unable to prove otherwise had to bite the bullet and pay extra for breakfast. All in all, enjoyed the city and will return, but not to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, good location and v.good staff for a 3 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AudaciousAussie
Reviews.Content: Staying over the new years weekend in a balcony room over looking La Rambla may not have been the most well thought out plan - however double glazed doors, black out curtains, ok, and us being a little boozed, saw to a good night's sleep. The front desk staff were extremely helpful, the rooms we were in were modern and spotless and while the wifi doesn't seem to stretch to all the rooms at least it's free! Good mid-priced hotel in a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: laurel a
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before our Med Cruise, and loved it. Right on La Ramblas, the best was sitting in the outside restaurant watching all the tourists stroll by every evening. The staff was VERY HELPFUL and spoke English well. Free Wi-Fi, which we later learned was rare in Europe. We had a lovely room over looking La Ramblas, and the hotel was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended for Families”
Reviews.Author: Richard J
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was lovely - I thought the suite we had was excellent value. However, it is a few doors down from a sex shop which seems to have created a 'micro-red light district' around it. When we left or returned to the hotel in the evening we had to run the gauntlet of prostitutes who had, let’s say, aggressive marking strategies and did not want to take no for an answer. My partner and I, both in our 40s, found this a very intimidating experience. Families should not even consider coming here. We'd like to go back to this hotel; it is excellent value, the rooms were comfortable, clean and tastefully decorated. But we wouldn't go back until the hotel has made some effort to address this problem - they are clearly just ignoring it at the moment. A doorman who could warn the working girls off would go some way to improving the situation I think.

Reviews.Title: “Two Great Stays”
Reviews.Author: moabgreg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before and after a Mediterranean cruise. There were seven of us, and we had three rooms. The location is fabulous! The staff was very kind and helpful - especially Christina. The hotel and rooms were very clean, roomy, and modern. The mattresses were firm -something I like, but not everyone would. We never had any problems with anyone outside the hotel. We loved the location because it was handy to EVERYTHING! I would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Hotel Arc La Ramblia”
Reviews.Author: Susan D
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in this Hotel this month We had a lovely room with a Balcony the Hotel was very clean and the staff very helpful and friendly. Yes it may be a bit noisier in the balcony rooms as they are at the front of the building near all the night life and part of the calture of this area. We may not have been down on the street ourselves but great to watch from our room. above and you can always shut your windows and shutters. The breakfast was excellant and plenty to choose from. We would with doubt stay in this Hotel again. Barcelona is fantastic lots of shops and would recommend the bus tours as your gain a good in site into what you can visit. the 2 day tickets work out cheaper and without doubt worth it. Thank you Hotel Arc La Ramble for a great stay Sue and Mike England

Reviews.Title: “Good Value/Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette B
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have stayed in Barcelona 7 times, but never at this hotel. I was a little worried when I read some of the reviews as I had booked the weekend as a Christmas present for my partner....I needn't have worried. We had a superior room overlooking Las Ramblas. The room was great, cleaned daily, fresh towels, etc, etc. Staff are helpful and extremely pleasant. We didn't eat at the hotel but had a couple of drinks at the restaurant attached...again great staff, and atmosphere. Yes the hotel is situated between a peep show establishment and prostitutes are in the area...hardly threatening though (there were 2 in total) best way to deal with it is laugh them off...do watch your bags/pockets though as their minders leave a little bit to be desired...just normal street awareness. Anyway the hotel is ideally situated to explore Barcelona...Mickeys bar/restaurant a couple of doors away excellent food. Hard Rock Cafe well worth a visit. This hotel is central for all your needs whilst in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NOBBYSussex
Reviews.Content: Well great hotel right in amongst it all!! Rooms were great and they were refurbishing the rest of the rooms while i was there, only issue is how Barcelona makes London look cheap!!! If you buy a drink on La Rambla make sure you tell them a size otherwise you get a bucket of beer and bowl of sangria all for 26 EUROS!!!!! Taxi from the airport is now 35 euros 2 years ago it was 25 typical spanish hard times lets put the prices up, but apart from the cost it was a great trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: eviegorl
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel , after reading a few poor reviews. The room was basic but adequate , the breakfast was excellent and the location just right. The staff were extremely helpful and the standard of cleanliness was very high. They also cater very well for visitors who have a long wait after their checkout time , with comfortable seating , luggage storage etc.I would not hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: DSNH19
Reviews.Content: There's no doubt about it, Barcelona is an amazing city!!!!! This hotel is great, it has many reasons why! The location couldn't be better for us, such a great base to explore the city! Nearly at the bottom of las ramblas street, we absolutely loved the whole atmosphere of the street! Some reviews do talk about the sex shops and things being beside the hotel-which is true, really it's nothing to worry about- just the same as an Anne summers in the high street of our city I suppose?! ... Also for the prositutes at night- they really are harmless, a few approached my boyfriend but kinda just need to laugh about it and walk on! I see what people mean though!!! The hotel itself is really lovely, really nice for a 3 star!!!! The only thing we would say is that the room was a bit of an issue for us ( not a major issue though ) .. We got a superior room, the room was lovely to look at but was soooo hot!!!! After the first night we did find it very had to sleep, we called reception to advise that our air con wasn't working properly, reason for this though was that the air con doesn't work in winter months, only the heating can be turned on! We had a window but no air was getting in because it was surrounded by four wall! Sooo a big tip, upgrade to a superior room with balcony if you are going in the winter months as at least then there is fresh air coming in through there!!!! We didn't bother as we just used the room to get ready and obviously sleep in!! Breakfast in the morning was lovely, always filled our bellys!!! Overall the experience was lovely, we would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gordon R
Reviews.Content: In a great location right in the heart of La Rambla. Rooms small but adequate, clean and comfortable. Excellent choice from the buffet breakfast and very helpful friendly staff. We asked for a quiet room on an upper floor and that is what we got. The hotel is not actually next to a sex shop as stated by some reviewers, the sex shop is a few doors down the street and did not pose us any problems. If you want a good value room in the heart of Barcelona then you could do a lot worse. Gordon and Rose

Reviews.Title: “good location, nice hotel, poor logistics”
Reviews.Author: helen b
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a good location, right on La Ramblas. I would definitely book a superior room with balcony. We were given an upgrade to this room which was still pretty small and a travelodge standard. However the view out of the room on the balcony made up for it. Right in the middle of things. Was disappointed by the fact that we had booked the room for my partner and I as a couple, turned up and were given the key for a twin room. We rang down and were told there were no doubles available in the hotel. But if we wanted we could be downgraded the next day for a standard double at the back of the hotel. Not exactly the greatest customer service I've ever received. We didn't book breakfast and I'd probably suggest that you get a better experience eating elsewhere and it would definitely work out cheaper. The hotel is on one of the most popular streets in Barcelona however it's definitely at the quieter end of the street and is next to a sex shop. I would probably say there are hotels that represent a better value for money, however I think some of the reviews on here are extremely harsh and the hotel was not as bad as some of the reviews suggest. I was reading the reviews with dread so was actually pleasantly surprised. I imagine that the lack of double rooms was just a one off- but I would recommend stating on booking.com etc or whichever company you book through that you want a room at the front and whether you want a double or twin very clearly

Reviews.Title: “Arc La Rambla - Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Edgcumbe
Reviews.Content: We were in Barcelona for our first ever visit and had booked in to the Hotel Arc Rambla for 5 days. The reception staff were great. The hotel was ideally situated which allowed us to walk to all the areas we wanted to visit or take the excellent underground system! We had a great room with a large balcony which was bathed in the afternoon sun! After two nights we found the buzz of happy revellers from the streets below kept us awake. We requested a move and were dealt with graciously and efficiently and were moved to another suite which resulted in 3 good nights rest. There is a restaurant inside the hotel which does a great breakfast but the other restaurant accessible from the hotel has a great variety of food all day long. The staff were great. It is worth bearing in mind that it is cheaper to eat in rather tan outside on the pavement extension of the restaurant as there may be an additional charge for table service. Check this out before you order your meal. The Hotel Arc La Rambla is ideally situated to access key areas of Barcelona and is near to all the transport locations. The hotel is well presetned. It is very clean and well maintained with very courteous,efficient, and helpful staff. We enjoyed our stay immensely and would definetly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it!!”
Reviews.Author: Veryan W
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a few days in Barcelona, staying at the Arc de la Rambla Hotel. I couldn't fault it for cleanliness, value, friendliness and convenience. We took the train and metro from the airport, which was quick and easy, with the metro station nealr next door to the hotel. Breakfast was relaxed, tasty and plentiful. We were near the lovely seascape and walked around the harbour and marina, and were also in easy reach of the shops, catherdral and food market (not to be missed!!).Both of the open topped bus trips stopped within a couple of minutes walk from the hotel and the reception staff looked up anything that we needed to know on the internet, and had brochures to give us on all the places of local interest. I would recommend it to everyone - I took photos of our room and breakfast room, but they are identical to the ones shown on the website, so I have not included them with this review. You could probably pay lots more for a hotel, but I am not sure what you would gain, as there is so much to see in Barcelona, I would not want to be sitting in a hotel room when I could be out and about absorbing the atmosphere of this beautiful and vibrant city. We also were within easy reach of some very good restaurants, just off Le Ramblas, which had excellent food at reasonable prices. The bar next door was good too, welcoming and not 'touristy', also worth a vist for a quiet drink - their brandy was the best I've tasted. Overall - I will definately stay there again if I go back to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and best value”
Reviews.Author: GalwayLinda
Reviews.Content: You really couldn't find a better location in Barcelona. Everywhere is so accessible from this hotel, most things are easily within walking distance and Drassanes metro is less than 2min walk. The rooms are pretty basic but very clean. I requested a room at the back of the hotel so noise wasn't much of an issue. You won't get anywhere cheaper in this location unless you want to stay in a hostel. The staff were very friendly and welcoming at reception, nice buffet breakfast included and on the day we were leaving we checked out early and wanted to do some sightseeing before we caught our train and the staff let us store all our luggage in the hotel until late that evening. They also helped us arrange tours etc. Perfect for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Elky--Judy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the recommendation of our Travel Agent before a cruise. The location was perfect, short trip to the pier in the morning and easy to walk to many sites + the subway. Bed was hard, but it wasn't too bad, if you love soft mattresses this is probably not the place for you. Safe was included, no fridge, bathroom was functional and had good space. Breakfast was wonderful in a typical Spanish style, meats, cheeses and breads. Don't come looking for eggs! Cappacino was also included in the breakfast. I would stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping on the floor”
Reviews.Author: Kollegski75
Reviews.Content: Ok, its a cheap hotel with a good location, close to everything. Still its just not worth the money. The beds are rock hard, like sleeping on the floor and theres not even a refrigerator.Dont stay here, pay a bit more and wake up rested. Otherwise bring painkillers , your gonna need them..and dont bother with the breakfast, Starbucks is just 5 min away.

Reviews.Title: “Only good if you choose the superior room with balcony”
Reviews.Author: Tine_Babiarz
Reviews.Content: Perfect location at the end of the Rambla, close to the beach and the charming Bari Gothic with tons of small tapas places, fascinating architecture, nice boutiques and small vintage shops. There was surprisingly little noise in the evening, though I definetely wouldn't recommend this place for a family with children. It's rare that I feel unsafe, but the Rambla at night really is a place, where prostitutes, pick pockets and drunk people hang out. One night I actually saw a - hmmm, what to call it - very sexual explicit incident from our balcony on the sidewalk just infront of the hotel. Anyway: We - me and a friend - had booked a superior room with balcony and it was my impression after taking a sneak view of the standard rooms, which seemed really claustrophobic in my oppinion, that the extra money you pay for a superior are well spend, eventhough it's a bit overpriced compared to other places in Barcelona. Had we lived in a standard room, I would probably have rated the hotel 'poor'. The interior of the reception and the rooms is not as appealing and new as showed in the hotel advertising photos, but it's clean and the beds are good to sleep in, and the staff is really nice and polite. Overall a good experience, but you can get even more value for your money if you choose a private rental in Bari Gothic or Born.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location , great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jon_R5
Reviews.Content: Such a brilliant location, the hotel is at the harbour end of La Rambla and perfect for getting out and about in Barcelona. So many restaurants and bars within 5 or 10 minutes walk although the smaller squares just off La Rambla seem to be much cheaper. Staff were very helpful and spoke excellent English. The hotel has a lot of rooms and reception is often very busy but the desk staff were always polite and courteous to everyone. The two rooms that we booked were almost mini-suites with everything you could want. Good comfortable beds, nice hot showers, air conditioning etc. Even though it's a busy area that seems to be lively all night the rooms were fairly quiet, the odd noise from the street was obviously expected though. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at La Rambla and would recommend it to anyone for a short stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, great experience overall!!”
Reviews.Author: Stagemike
Reviews.Content: One of the best locations, walk out the door and your on La Rambla. The staff were incredible, helpful and friendly. My wife and I dealt mostly with Daniel at the front desk and couldnt have asked for better service. Had a fantastic time in Barcelona and staying at La Rambla definitely contributed to some fantastic memories.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: UKTravellers89
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended. - Forget the adverse comments re sex shops and prostitutes, this is a well run modern hotel in a superb location, The young enthusiastic reception staff were very helpful, the rooms were clean with a good bed and well equipped bathroom. Quite simply an excellent tourist hotel

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed at my first stop in Europe”
Reviews.Author: WilQ
Reviews.Content: Rooms in Arc La Rambla face the La Rambla street directly but they are small and old. Location probably is the only good thing. But you can find some great boutique hotels nearby at more reasonable price. And I will not stay in it again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Ormestoun
Reviews.Content: La Rambla is an exciting place but beware of pickpockets and (if you are of the male persuasion) prostitutes! In fact there are signs in various parts of the city warning of pickpockets. The hotel is good and comfortable with a cafe right next door for breakfast - or go to Cafe de l'Opera on the other side of the Rambla and slightly further up - their Spanish omelettes will set you up for the day. The layout of the hotel means that if you are on the ground floor you may be looking out at a small enclosed atrium - we were on the top floor and had to crane to see what colour the sky was! Barcelona is a fantastic place - the Gaudi stuff is amazing - especially the Sagrada Familia, but also the other buildings and Parc Guell - though the park is quite complicated to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Dadavs_11
Reviews.Content: Me and my sister stayed for 3 nights and found the hotel very conveniently near several metro stations. The staff at the desk were friendly and helpful. Our room was small but just what we needed to relax after discovering the city sights. It was on the La Rambla and we could see and enjoy the hustle and bustle of the street at all hours. fortunately we could not hear the noises during the night due to the thick window and shutters.

Reviews.Title: “Spartan Hotel, Seedy Location”
Reviews.Author: Bmanwest
Reviews.Content: We made our room reservation with Hotel Arc La Rambla online in anticipation of a pre-cruise hotel that was cheap and centrally located. The hotel is advertised as a three star hotel, it has free Wi-Fi and two adjoining restaurants. We arrived on an early flight and were told that we could secure our luggage in bus station-type wall lockers for two euros per locker until our room was ready to be occupied. The taxi fare to the hotel from the airport was 35 euros with tip (it cost about ten euros to take a taxi to the ship). After we ate a good lunch next door our room was ready for us to bring up our luggage. The room was very small and so narrow that I had to turn sideways to walk in front of the bed. The Ikea type furniture was very spartan, there were no drawers to put clothes in. Our room had no refrigerator, phone, alarm clock, coffee maker, ice bucket (hotel has no ice machines, you have to ask the front desk to get it), extra blankets or pillows. On the plus side, the bathroom was very large for the room with a full sized tub and plenty of hot water. It also had towels, soap,shampoo, and a waste basket. The beds were not that comfortable but at least the mattresses had springs in them. I slept soundly the first night but had a sore back after the second night. The room/hotel seemed to be pretty clean although there was plenty of wear and stains in the carpeting. Every staff member but our housekeeping lady was friendly and helpful. The hotel has no pool but does have a terrace for sun bathing on the top floor. The selling point for the hotel is the location. It is located about a block from the southern end of La Rambla, walking distance to the port and the traffic circle where you can catch sight seeing buses. It is also close to the metro. Unfortunately it is also two doors down from the Peep Show and Sex Shop, and this “Prime location” is a haven for pickpockets, prostitutes, transvestites, and homeless people who use the sidewalk for their toilet. The place reeks of urine. Finally, you can’t escape noticing the crime in the old quarter, people are constantly getting robbed despite the presence of cops everywhere. During my three days in Barcelona I saw no less than five couples call police after the pickpockets got to them. One couple got robbed inside the SuperMercado grocery store across the street from the hotel. Two more got robbed in the area in front of KFC. You’re a target on the street people, beware! I think I can say with confidence that the Hotel Arc La Rambla is a good TWO STAR hotel if you don’t have children and IF you can get a room for less than seventy five euros. I previously stayed at the Avenida Palace Hotel located about a mile north of La Rambla, paid about 150 a night, and thoroughly enjoyed the elegance, comfort, and security of the place. I suggest paying the extra money to stay in a quality hotel in Barcelona, you can’t go by how many stars an establishment advertises itself as having. I also highly recommend not staying on La Rambla, particularly if you have children. It’s worth a stroll and there are many nice shops and restaurants in the area, but you’ll have to keep your guard up the entire time you’re there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for downtown trips/walks”
Reviews.Author: Kroulak
Reviews.Content: After many experience- all hotel categories over the world- we can recomand this hotel . Check-in: good service, (arrive 1:30 p.m.), all information they had in hotel system, quickly. Breakfast: typical hotel menu, all was fresh, friendly staff, really OK for this hotel category. Room: not new, but quality materials. Clean, nice service for our 1 yr old son. Check-out:very quickly, lady at reception has a sharp invoice, no problem pamyent via card. Its only few steps walk from reception to La Rambla street and public transport to downtown. Great for evening/night city live discovery! Really excellent location for 4-6 days city trip!

Reviews.Title: “good for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Jess029
Reviews.Content: me and my partner stayed here for 3 nights we wanted to see all the sights and wanted to be close to resturants and bars ect ect. We found this hotel perfect for that, rooms were smalled but ours was upto date and comfortable for the 3 nights, didnt have a balcony. We found the location fantastic, bottom end of las ramblas. over all would go back here and stay but if you want 5 star luxery stay somwere else.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, reasonably priced, spacious room with view”
Reviews.Author: bwv582
Reviews.Content: Hotel Arc is conveniently situated between two metro stations (Drassanes & Liceu). The receptionist readily obliged with my request for a room facing the La Rambla boardwalk, which is always lively and entertaining. When shuttered, the balcony doors were effectively sound proof. The room was spacious and clean, though the bed was a bit on the hard side. Good WiFi signal throughout the building including in the restaurant. I was in town for a performance at the Teatro del Liceu, which turned out to be within 10 minutes' walk from the hotel. My booking was made with 1800hotels.com.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great position”
Reviews.Author: pujro
Reviews.Content: Ideally situated just a few minutes from the end of La Rambla(sea end). Helpful staff. Plain but functional air conditioned rooms. Our rooms were quiet but in view of earlier comments it may be worth asking the room position you have. Pleasant seating areas and adjoining tapas bar. Free Wifi but signal weak in some areas.

Reviews.Title: “not so pleasant”
Reviews.Author: jov07
Reviews.Content: My partner and i booked this hotel via the interent back last year...the pictures looked extremely satisfying....it wasnt until we entered our room did everything go downhill from their....my partner and i obviously wanted to share a double bed like majority of couples do...instead we were given 2 single beds which intially we werent to fussed with the idea but however still somehow wanted a double bed....i popped downstairs to ask the reception if we could be transfered into a room which had that....the reply was very aprupt and i personally felt brushed off....they said just to push the beds together and that their are only....quote "10 ROOMS IN THE WHOLE HOTEL WHICH HAVE THIS...AND NON ARE AVAILABLE".....that was quite a poor and lame excuse..... the second problem was the bathroom stunk extremely on sewrage constantly...even when the cleaning ladies came through....it was a retaining smell....it was constantly loud at all hours of the night....it was extremely unpleasant having prostitues, drug dealers and idiots yelling and provoking sexual intercourse and trying to sell you drugs the minute you step onto the balcony of La Rambla the street we were facing off the 1st floor.....we asked to be moved a few times because it became quite uncomfortable for both my partner and i as well as that my partner specifically asked for a room with a double bed and it was not provided, but everything seem to be an inconvience and to hard a thing to do......the customer service coming from Australia was very rude and abrupt....maybe i was expecting to much considering we are quite friendly at home and the mentality might be a little different....but at the same time working at a hotel and expecting tourists to be entering and exiting the hotel, good customer service is expected......some of the staff should definately be taught to be a lil more social and hospitable rather than arrogant and abrupt....i do not recommend this hotel unless your planning not to sleep at all...the positioning is great in terms of centre of action and is located close to Port Vell and a 15mins walk to the beaches.....apart from that my partner and i definately experienced something we would never forget in a negative aspect.....

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this one”
Reviews.Author: vanishalev
Reviews.Content: First room we were assigned was TINY - barely space to turn around. Asked for upgrade. Room was a bit bigger, but dark and dingy. Odd stain on the (yes, dark green) wall above bed. Carpet in hallway (not sure if the carpet was originally green or brown) is littered with stains. Really just awful. I'm used to small rooms when visiting Europe - but this one was small and just plain yucky. The only bright spot - the breakfast room was clean, bright, cheery. And a nice selection of food.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Beds are as comforable as concrete slab...”
Reviews.Author: dcwildman
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms--1 balcony and 1 interior. After checking in and seeing the interior room, we were a little shocked. The room was bleak, the ceiling was painted black, and it just felt like a dungeon. We opted to upgrade the second room to a balcony view as well. Although right on La Rambla, the balcony doors are insulated enough that the noise was not bothersome. The rooms were clean, but the beds were awfully hard~we hardly slept well at all. We used the 5th floor rooftop terrace for drinks in the afternoon. The terrace is quite sparse...4 chairs...and that was it. There is so much potential with the property and lots of little touches could be done to make it feel like a higher end hotel. The location is ideal--close to subway and restaurants--management should focus on sprucing up the amenities. Their reviews would improve as well. Side note--be aware of the "ladies" who loiter outside the hotel doors at night. They are quite aggressive and work together to create diversions to try to pick-pocket. Not sure why the hotel staff doesn't do more to keep them from loitering outside their doors--perhaps they don't have the authority, but travelers need to be aware of them.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but terrible room”
Reviews.Author: KendallLondon
Reviews.Content: First impression of the hotel was good but could not believe the awful room. It was so dark the lights had to be on even during a sunny day. It had a small window that overlooked a small shaft . The bathroom was clean but very old with cracked tiles. The beds had, no head boards and had dark grey coverlets. It looked like and felt like a prison cell. Thank god I had only booked a 2 night stay! Having said that the breakfast room was nice and there was plenty to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but check your room before you check-in”
Reviews.Author: TomS84
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights as a short honeymoon. Good location near Drassanes Metro, Port Vell and the Barri Gotic. The first room we were given was poor (tiny, two separate beds, small bath with no shower curtain, dark) so we immediately asked for an upgrade and were given a clean, well-equipped and spacious room with a balcony overlooking La Ramblas. Reception staff were pleased to make the change. Lots of reviews on this site mention that this is the seedier end of the street. Whilst this may be so, we really didn't experience any problems that one wouldn't expect from a city centre location. We did have a good stay but having seen the difference between the two standards of room, our holiday could have easily been spoiled if we had stayed in the first (a pricing re-structure might be in order!).

Reviews.Title: “Choose the suites”
Reviews.Author: Sol0123
Reviews.Content: We brought a child and booked a junior suite. That was well worth the extra money and can be recommended. However, the room was smaller than I had expected from the pictures, but the bathroom was huge and the entrence had lot of space for suitcases etc. It had a nice balcony, but no view. We really missed a fridge in the room. The location could not be better (on the Rambla, close to the harbour area and the gotic districts with lots of restaurants). Breakfast was also adequat and worth the 10 euros compared to other restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, low fares”
Reviews.Author: dany_sprint
Reviews.Content: I really had a great time here. The hotel is easy to find and 100% in the city centre! Simple but clean rooms

Reviews.Title: “clean , good location , decent standard , good value.”
Reviews.Author: mallorytowers_11
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the heart of Las Ramblas, this hotel is reasonably priced with a good location for entertainment , transport and clean .It has a bar ,wifi ,lockers,weighing machine,solarium.Downside;if your on 1st ,2nd floors it is quite noisy. Overall i would recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced in a convenient and safe location , clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Geeets
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful, my standard no frills room was very clean and bigger than I expected, it had two twin beds and a chair that could fold out into a third bed. The closet had a safe and there was a folding rack for my suitcase, no refrigerator. The simple but roomy bathroom had a hairdryer. The view from the windows was onto an ugly utility court in the back, but it did not matter much since I spent all my time walking about the city and came back to the hotel only to sleep. If you want a room with a view o make sure it faces the Street, but then that could be noisy too,my back room was pretty quiet. There is a small tapas restaurant attached to the hotel where you can have breakfast , lunch or dinner, although I never tried any of it. There are so many other places around, my favorite in a market hall nearby. The Metro station Drassanes is a minute away and has an elevator , so I took public transportation back to the airport, which was extremely easy and inexpensive. Walking through the neighborhood by myself after dark I felt perfectly safe, which can be tricky for a woman travelling solo. there are many attractions within walking distance and the metro takes you the farther away places in a jiffy. All in all this hotel is a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel...Shocking Location!”
Reviews.Author: Gary186402
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel as our base for a stag weekend. The hotel itself was ok, most of the rooms we had were nice enough, but others resembled prison cells with a tiny window or no windows at all! Although the location of the hotel is excellent for access to bar's and the beach/harbour area, it seems to attract some of Barcelona's worst. Every evening we would return to the hotel to run the gauntlet of large groups of prostitutes who physically grabbed, groped and goaded us as we tried in vain to open the main Hotel door. (There is a adult shop next door) Two members of our group were also pick-pocketed on our first day. Overall we had a great weekend, but if we were to go again, we wouldn't stay at Hotel Arc La Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely convenient & clean with great buffet breakfast”
Reviews.Author: StephanRau
Reviews.Content: We had a "superior " suite with balcony and breakfast included. We stayed 2 days before and 7 days ( over Xmas) after our cruise. The hotel is close to the port, the subway, buses and is on La Rambla which is full of life and a treat in itself. The staff are all friendly and competent. The front desk is mostly busy and one has to excercise a little patience during the rush hours but once attended to the going is smooth. I would highly recommend it for a base because of it's central location in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!!!”
Reviews.Author: sean_storey21
Reviews.Content: the hotel its self isnt bad its the area that surrounds it i shud of been there still as i write this but have had to come home to newcastle upon tyne due to haveing all of my spending money pickpocketed on the first night along with a £150 digital camera the local people are arrogant and self centered it is the worst city i have been to in my whole entire life of traveling would not recomend it to anyone unless you like haveing your money and personal things stolen and all though the hotel is nice there is a horrible sordid little sex shop and peep show next door where all the working girls and drug dealers hang out and they are the ones that target tourists like what happend to myself and my friend go there at your own risk

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: GillianMarinus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated at the port-end of the Rambla. Very close to the Drassenes Metro station. We chose to stay there as we were boarding a cruise ship. We had a big bedroom with a balcony. It was very comfortable and clean. The bathroom was also very spacious. I did see the soiled carpet on the third floor that was mentioned in other reviews but the rest of the floors had been refurbished and were all clean. The continental breakfast was plentiful and the dining room was very cosy unlike some of the hostal-like dining rooms I have experienced! The hotel has a lift.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded us for boyfriend's birthday-Great location for first-timers to the city!”
Reviews.Author: QueensRocks
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for two nights here in the late springtime. He had been to Barcelona before but I never been and wanted to go for years. We weren't disappointed. We booked this hotel online a few weeks before on venere.com based on good reviews and value for money. It was close to my boyfriend's birthday and I asked them to upgrade us. They did and our room faced Las Ramblas with a little balcony big enough for three or four people to sit outside and watch the traffic go by. Due to some of the volcano ash problems my plane from New York arrived very late in comparison to my boyfriend's flight from Belgium. He arrived at the hotel hours before I even made it into Spain. Since he hadn't heard from me he told the front desk staff he was anxiously awaiting me. Once I arrived, they recognized me and brought me straight upstairs so my honey and I could reunite! The staff were very thoughtful and I'm thankful for their customer care. The hotel is well located on Las Ramblas and was a great point of reference for getting around town. We took the local metro, which was only a block away from the hotel. It was easy to walk around the area and there were some charming bars on sidestreets. We did notice some hookers two doors down from the hotel at a sleazy saloon, but I'm from New York, so they didn't scare me. Just some nonsense to avoid on your way to better places. The staff gave us recommendations of where to rent bikes, motorcycles, and good directions to take the bus to the Parc Guell, which Gaudi built. I'd stay again because of the good price, clean rooms, comfy bed, ideal location and comfy bed. But one of these days I'd hope to afford one of the nicer hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short stay in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: s0phie_e
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Barcelona for 2 nights in November to see Barca vs Villareal and various other sightseeing just to get a good feel for the city. The hotel was perfect for a short stay - good facilities, easy check-in and location wise bang smack in the middle of las ramblas where the street theatre, characaturists etc are literally a stones throw away. Its also close to the food market which was fun to walk around. The harbour and the gothic quarter are also very close by and there is a metro station right outside which made it very easy for us to get to the nou camp for the footie. The room we stayed in was small but no need for anything bigger really for the amount of time we actually stayed in the hotel. Overall would definitely recommend for a short break but would advise upgrading to a bigger room if going for more than 2/3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: noosasunshine
Reviews.Content: What a great find,right on the La Rambla towards the Harbour and a easy walk to the Cruise Terminal,We went for the junior suite that was half the price for a doulbe room at Hotel Arts,Our room had a separate lounge and also a balcony that was at the back of the hotel,thus avoiding the street noise at night.The other advantage a very good cafe next door,as you can appreciate we are right into the action of this vibrant city.Our 3 night stay we enjoyed now looking forward to the cruise and some rest.if you want a reasonablehotel this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: barcelona2011
Reviews.Content: I booked a weekend in Barcelona as a surprise for my wife, So i was looking for a Hotel, located on la Rambla, I found Arc la Rambla on a Bareclona hotel site. I read several reviews mostly which were very favourable. I booked the hotel requesting a room over-looking La rambla, On arrival at the hotel, We were pleasantly surprised, it was in a great location on la rambla, very clean and the staff were very pleasant, and they also gave us a room over-looking la rambla (at no extra cost). The room was very nice and clean, and the rooms were cleaned daily, I am going back to Barcelona in April 2011 and will be staying at Arc La Rambla again, and I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to friends and family, Give it a try you will be very very surprised, a truely wonderful hotel

Reviews.Title: “Could be a fantastic hotel. Great location. Staff let it down.”
Reviews.Author: Traveller255097
Reviews.Content: This was a funny place. We had no accommodation on arrival. We walked in off the street. Had I read the reviews On trip advisor I wouldn't have stayed here...The entrance foyer looked great so based on that, and the really good rate they gave us we booked for two nights. When we got out of the lift we thought what have we done. The carpet was putrid. It was stained and looked very unclean. We were a little fearful of how our room would look. But we were pleasantly surprised. The room was very very clean, and modern. We had upgraded to a suite, so we were in one room, and the kids were in the lounge on the fold out bed. The bathroom was large and it had a small balcony overlooking the back area of the hotel. We ended up booking again for another four nights.they gave us an even better rate for the next four nights. This hotel could be a fantastic. The carpet in the hallways desperately needs replacing and the staff need to be polite. The staff overall were not helpful or friendly They would not offer to help organize or Book anything for you. In fact they seem to go out of their way to be rude to you. One night we needed a babysitter. When i asked the front desk about this he just said don't know and looked back down to his computer. After staying there several nights and seeing the same faces on the desk they still never said hi on entry or exit. There was one girl who was helpful and friendly. She needs to train the rest of the staff. The hotel is in an amazing location and the rooms are really clean and good value for money. The rooms do not have a fridge. If they were more friendly they would have a great hotel.The hotel is right on the rambla. You step out the door and you are in the thick of it. Some reviews mentioned this was the seedy end of town. We didn't feel like that at all and had two young children with us. WARNING. Expect to be pick pocketed on the rambla Take nothing except small amount of cash in your front pocket. There were hundreds of people queued every night at the police station reporting stolen items.

Reviews.Title: “In heart of city but needs a good overhaul”
Reviews.Author: alanNrich
Reviews.Content: GREAT location but our room did need a bit of a makeover. VERY 80s decor in our room. Front desk areas were good but disappointed with our room. Only would recommend to a friend for LOCATION and if they upgrade to superior room. We did have a LARGE outdoor balcony at the back of the property which was a bonus. Friendly reception. We didn't take breakfast here as the amazing La Boqueria market was just yards from the hotel. Just around the corner was the Tutankhamun exhibit which was great. BE VERY AWARE OF PICK POCKETS on Las Rambles (not just the hotel end). We caught people trying to do it to us then later that evening stopped them form doing it to another couple. They tend to do it as you watch street performers. Keep nothing in pockets. ZIP everything of value away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor value for money.”
Reviews.Author: newtorw
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel primarily for it's location which did not dissapoint in anyway! But, the costing of the superior room with breakfast and balcony left alot to be desired, on arrival we were met the the lead lady in Les Miserable, and all but one male member of staff gave the impression that they were there under duress! The room was around Travel Lodge standard but £320 odd pounds for a room with no toilet brush or tea making facilities?? The walls needed a real new coat of paint, being badly scuffed, bathroom was clean but basic.The two singles were lited straight from the local prison cell in terms of the comfort; rock hard, not good! Now we come to the breakfast, wev'e done Barca a few times and know the abundance of fresh produce available, not a drop of cold milk, boiled egg or slice of melon anywhere in sight,and again manned by Mrs Grumpy, oh dear. Great location, full stop. Sorry, but the truth has to be told when it costs that much, and you don't get the return!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service, spacious clean room.”
Reviews.Author: Ariby_GM
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the lower end of Las Ramblas which is perfect if you need to get to the cruise terminal at the local port. We did not see or encounter any of the previously mentioned sex shops or prostitutes. We stayed in one of the 'Superior with Balcony' rooms, which was spacious and clean. The bed was comfortable & the air-conditioning was in good working order which meant a good night's sleep was not a problem. The staff at the reception desk were all friendly and helpful, we did not try the breakfast facilities as we preferred to go our own way. We had Wi-Fi available which we believe is available in all rooms for free - just get the SSID & password at the reception desk. Also available is a Solarium, which is nice for those wanting to relax in the sun. The hotel also has lockers (big enough for most luggage) which are handy for when you have checked out but still have a few hours left in the city before your next/final destination.

Reviews.Title: “single parent with teenager, would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: JR2324
Reviews.Content: Arc La Rambla, 7 nights in June 2010 Travelers are a single parent with teenage daughter. Booked it on a major hotel website. Pros: Nice entryway, hotel is easy to locate as it is on the lower end of Las Ramblas, (towards beach/docks). Check in fairly easy, lift will accommodate two people with full size luggage each. Room itself, (standard room), is basic, two beds, a small desk and a particle board armoire, it did suit our needs. Shower has good water pressure. Staff friendly, we had minimal interaction but that which we did have was positive. Cons: location, although this is on Las Ramblas, it is on the lower end, as opposed to the upper end, which is at Placa Catalunya. The hotel happens to be next to a sex shop or adult store, and every night, we would see prostitutes, and the men who would frequent them. No big deal, but if you are with kids, I would not recommend the location. We were walking out and about later in the evening and overall felt safe, that is, we were not approached by anybody but as a parent, your gut tightens up as you walk through that area. Another con is the in room safe. It can accommodate a small laptop, has the combo function but it is not secured or mounted to any object. A person could literally walk off with this. I did speak to front desk about deposit box and was told they have none and are not liable for items stolen. Nothing was taken but it remained an uneasy feeling. This hotel does offer a breakfast however we did not partake so I can't comment, other than to say it is 10 Euros per person, 8 if you book at least two days in advance. There is a daily produce/meat/fish market up the street, on the left hand side as you walk towards Plaza Catalunya, that has many vendors. We had fresh bread, fruit, coffee, juice, daily and prices were reasonable. There is s self service Laundromat nearby, the hotel will provide flyers for it. The small front end washers are 4.50 Euros, large tumble dryer is 1 euro per ten minutes, (twenty minutes should have your clothes dried). They do sell soap, not sure how much as we packed ours. Overall, Las Ramblas is a great place to visit, and lots of nice little plazas off the main road, that offer great deals on food. Regarding the hotel, it served a basic function but as a single parent, I would not stay here again, given the in room safe issue, as well as the outside environment, regarding the sex workers. Some of the reviews I have read stated that walls were thin, and you could hear your neighbors, we really did not have that problem, other than a door occasionally shutting hard, which you can hear in any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about location”
Reviews.Author: choclo_265
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in this hotel and no it's not anything to rave about. But you really cannot beat the location. Its right on the Ramblas, which if its your first time you definitely want to stay there. It's toward the port side of the street so a little bit less crowded then the other side more toward the Plaza catalunya. Everything you want to see is no more than a 15 minute walk: the Gothic Qtr, the port and beaches, the arc de triumfo, Opera House, Zoo, I could go on. Regardless of where you stay on the Ramblas there will be noise. I guarantee it. We had a basic room. Nothing special at all, just a place to sleep and bathe. Why would you want a grand hotel room when you'll be gone literally all day? The shower wasn't great at all but we made due. The air conditioner kinda fought with us a bit. The people at the front desk were very helpful. They booked a couple tours for us. The restaurant next door was really very very good. We did not eat there all the time to try different places but their sangria was the largest and the cheapest we had. It's a basic hotel for basic needs. They don't advertise luxury. It provides exactly what you need.

Reviews.Title: “Central location but quite basic.”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa Z
Reviews.Content: Arc la Rambla is a good 2 star hotel but it's just that - 2 stars which means no frills. The standard room was quite bare but fine for sleeping in. It's great if you want a cheap few nights worth of accommodation in a central location in Barcelona. It's really close to a metro station to get to all the main sites. We stayed in room 205 where we could pick up wifi but reception was bad and kept dropping in and out which was annoying. Whilst we appreciate that it is 2 star it wouldn't hurt to put in a shower curtain! Everything was wet by the end of a short shower which wasn't pleasant. Our toilet broke half way through the stay but we were very quickly moved to a new room down the hall. Room 208 had much better wifi reception. Staff were helpful but could do with a few smiles on their faces. Room service was good everyday. Both rooms were quiet as they didn't face the main boulevard - La Rambla, however we can imagine it could be noisy for those rooms facing the street as the walls were paper-thin and we could hear the showers and noises of people ajoining rooms. Overall, great for a cheap stay but don't expect the world!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city trip!”
Reviews.Author: zuerich_10
Reviews.Content: We have booked the Hotel Arc La Rambla in April for 2 nights and took the Superior Room. As we arrived the reception was friendly and we could check-in very quickly. Luckily, the reception lady told us, that we've been upgraded because of the change of the rates in the meantime... it turned out that we received the Junior Suite, which was awesome! A big entrance room, a seating area for watching TV, a balcony & a huge bathroom - perfect! The hotel has a very good location, right on La Ramla, which is the main promenade of Barcelona. So you are in the middle of everything. It's only a 5 minutes walk to the beautiful port! Very stunning... at the port you can find the shopping mall "Maremagnum", which is very nice. A lot of restaurants, shops, cafés & seating areas are inviting to spend time there. Back in the hotel, we started to have problems with our flight back - it was cancelled because of the volcano and noone knew, when the next flight will leave from Barcelona. So we were depended on the reception and had to clarify if there is a possibility for us to stay. The staff was very friendly and blocked us the room for 2 more nights for the time being. It turned out, that after 2 more nights we stil had no flight back... so we had to hope another time, that the hotel can let us keep the room - but it was no problem at all! Finally, we ended up 6 nights at the hotel instead of 2 and we had a very pleasent stay. The hotel is totally recommandable for a city trip and people, that generally want to spend their time with sightseeing and walking around all day. It is not a hotel to spend a lot of time - and it's important to make sure to book at least one category over the Standard Room, because they are really tiny and compared to the rest of the rooms not likeable at all!

Reviews.Title: “a diamond”
Reviews.Author: mariemacLiverpool
Reviews.Content: We have just had a great break at Arc la Rambla. Excellent location and superb staff. We were upgraded and the room was more than adequate. Absolutely spotless and maid service every day. Room was a bit dark so we had lights on all the time, no great hardship. The beds were a bit hard but I was so tired I still slept well. Some people do seem to moan for moaning ' s sake. We went to see the city not stay in a hotel room. Book this hotel, oh there is a sex shop next door but one however you don't have to walk passed if you don't want to do you? Visit the Rialto Square about 5mins from hotel. Lively square with lots of bars and places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Was OK”
Reviews.Author: netibiza
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my two sisters, we are all in our 60's and were given a disgusting room with a window opening literally onto the washing area so the damp towels flopped into the room. We complained and paid £100 extra and got a super suite at the back at the top with a lovely balcony. The housekeeper was lovely, as were most of the receptionists, but there was a french girl who was totally rude and ignorant, being in mind that I can speak the local dialect of Catalan! Yes, would go there again if I go have the same suite.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC.....Will be returning”
Reviews.Author: bethnella
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two night stay here and had a great time. We were upgraded to a "superior" room when we arrived which got me very excited....until I saw the room! Tiny is about as good as it gets but we were so pleased with it. It was clean, smelled really nice, had a safe and a decent sized closet space. Yes, this hotel will always win on location as it is right on Las Ramblas but it also has great Wi Fi, lovely little breakfast (please dont expect egg and bacon!!! Toast, rolls, cereal, fruit, yoghurt, ham and cheese), and a safe 24hr reception who make you feel welcome and are very helpful. It is easy to get to from the aeroport and is just outside Dressandres station. Las Ramblas itself is not as long as I expected and be careful if you have a drink at any of the outside cafes on the main strip....they are EXPENSIVE!!!!!! 20 euros for a jug of sangria and 8 euros for a beer!!!!! Be warned, but all in all this hotel is perfect for a short stay in Barcelona and the cable car ride up to the castle is worth it as is the tour of the football stadium.....I hate football and went with my partner and by the end of it wished we were there for a match!

Reviews.Title: “We'll choose it again”
Reviews.Author: Pametnica
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located on the best place in Barcelona, in La Rambla street, near the Gotic quarter, Placa Cataluna, Mirador ...Just a minute away is the metro station and Maritime Museum....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - shame about the room...”
Reviews.Author: Superarabs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and in terms of location it is amazing, 2 min walk from metro and right on the Ramblas. In terms of the room, it was like a prison cell... Small window, no dressing table so for the ladies drying hair etc proved hard, no shower curtain so after a shower the bathroom was very very wet. Beds were quite hard but after walking all day I would have slept anywhere. Would reccomend for people that do not want to spend too much time in their hotel definately

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: amaliaChania
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the center of the town, easy to find and travel arround. Clean, and nice rooms, friendly staff. More than we expected from a 2 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: kezkezp
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Arc la Ramblas in January 10 and had a fantastic stay! Location is perfect location, right on the ramblas and within stumbling distance of the metro and marina. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, we arrived just hours before the Barcelona football game we were there to see and the guy on reception gave us fool proof directions, helping that the hotel is on the same line as the Nou Camp!!! We were on the 4th floor and although the room was spacious and well eqipped, the window was onto a inerior courtyard and it was quite airless, even in January. The walls were also apparently very thin and we could hear general hotel noise at pretty much all times. We had a bed and breakfast deal and the buffet is very well stocked (no bacon or sausage though!) and served til 11 so no rush to get up. All in all, i'd recommend it but maybe would stump up for a better room next time, maybe one with an outside wall and view! :) There's also a fab cheap and cheerful restaurant just over the road called La Fonda!

Reviews.Title: “Great location Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlmewburn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Arc La Rambla in Barcelona for 2 nights in October 09, We initially were given the wrong room by Reubens on reception which caused an embarrassing moment for ourselves and other couple who were already occupying the room. Reubens soon relocated us to what was our booked room which was on the 4th floor with a small balcony overlooking La Ramblas this was just a perfect position for a stay in Barcelona, central, close to transport, clean & with double glazed windows quiet as well. WE had the misfortune to blow the power to the whole 4th floor when we plugged in video camera recharger at 11PM but hotel had electrician there in no time to rectify the problem. Overall great hotel at great price and staff had great people skills

Reviews.Title: “no complaints”
Reviews.Author: kalimo
Reviews.Content: I have travelled extensively and usually stay in higher star hotels, but as I was travelling with family and friends for a Christmas shopping trip decided to go for something cheaper - I was dubious to say the least on booking a 2 star - but I have to say I was most impressed. The hotel looked impressive and on checking in (though slow) the staff were very helpful handing out lots of maps and local information. All the rooms (we had 5) were large, clean and comfortable and most were located at the back with large balconys (view though something to be desired!) but as they were at the rear they were very quiet. We only booked on room only so can't comment on the breakfast but did eat in the adjoining restaurant and used the bar next door, staff their were also courteous and the food was just 'ok'. The hotel also has two large roof sun decks which in the summer would be prefect for relaxing and chilling with wine and nibbles after a hard days shopping. All in all, the hotel and location was great and getting from the airport was cheap and easy - bus drops you at the top of the Ramblas and then a straight walk down approx 15 minutes. I have already recommended this great little hotel and will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: zmastercanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in mid-September (Superiour Room with Balcony). The hotel itself is nothing special, basic rooms & the balcony was tiny (could stand but not sit, certainly no room for table & chairs). We found the staff expremely nice, the wireless internet was free & fast (we used our Vonage phone over the wireless & had no quality issues when calling back to Canada) and had no problems getting around in English. It did take a couple of trys to get the shower door not to leak, but once we got the hand of it there were no further leaks. But as with real estate, its location-location-location ... <1 block from a metro station, walking distance to many historic sits, close to several 'touristy' resturants but many 'local' resturants off the main streets, and the Boquiero market is only a few blocks away. La Rambla is a busy street, so there is going to be noise well into the night, but we still slept with our window open. Breakfast was nothing special, especially with the Boquiero market so close, but it was convienent to just pop down & plot out the day over a several coffees and some toast. And at 119€ per night, with it location it was great value. It was our first trip to Barcelona, we can't wait to get back & would likely be staying at Hotel Arc La Rambla again. Lee

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: travelseeker13
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central, the reception staff were friendly and spoke good English. The room itself was a bit dated but, after reading other reviews, we requested a room on the top floor which had an exceptional view of La Rambla. We only stayed 1 night but the price was reasonable and just wanted we needed. Breakfast left a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel I have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: JNK2006
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review about a hotel before however it felt my duty to warn others about how poor this hotel was. Upon arrival the hotel seems nice however we waited half an hour to check in, there seemed to be three people behind the desk however only one serving, it took them half an hour to check in the couple before us. When we did finally check in the guy didnt speak any English and put our names wrong on the system and was extremely rude, he then took a further half hour to check us in. We were then told that the room wouuldnt be ready until 2pm and we could leave our bags in the storage area, however we had to pay 2 euros per bag to leave them there! The lift was broken so we had to walk up to the third floor with two large suitcases, we then arrived in our superior balcony room! Well there was nothing superior about it, the room smelt, the bathroom was horrendous you could only get either boiling hot water or freezing cold, nearly all of the tiles were cracked, you couldnt take a shower without the water going everywhere as there was no shower curtain. I think we had the water cylinder in our room for all the rooms on the floor as all you could hear all night was the cylinder dripping, the aircon unit was broke and would turn itself on and off whenever it pleased! If anybody even whispered in the adjoining rooms you could hear it clearly as the walls were paper thin, if you turned over in the bed at night the bed would move around the room. Every morning I couldnt move for half an hour as the bed was so horrific it made my back really bad, I would have been more comfy sleeping on the floor. The first night we were there they called the room at 12.30 in the morning to say that they had our names down wrong on the system!! Now the good parts, the rooms were cleaned everyday and the location was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Standard room was awful”
Reviews.Author: Dave_t0661
Reviews.Content: We booked a "standard" as opposed to a "superior" room. The room we were given was small and smelled strongly like a sewer. The small window looked into a dark 5x5 airshaft which contained all the noisy A/C units for all the rooms. The room's A/C unit was broken, and roared to life at completely random intervals ranging from a few minutes to 10-second bursts. We got no sleep. In the morning there were 2 small bugs in the bed. The hotel upgraded us to a superior room for the next two nights at no charge (usually 35E/night). It was like being in a different hotel - a modern, clean, decent room. Obviously, there is street noise from the Rambla, and the neighbourhood is a little sketchy at night (witness the arrest of several prostitutes under our window on night #2), but it is definitely central to many of the sights.

Reviews.Title: “No horror stories, No compaints, No sweat (even in the heat)!”
Reviews.Author: BenjyBedford
Reviews.Content: Okay, my previous booking company went bust so I was left with a flight to Barcelona but no hotel. I knew I wanted to stay in or near La Rambla but didn't have much money to spend as I was waiting for a response after claiming the money back that I'd lost with the previous booking company for a stay at another hotel in the city. I found Hotel Arc La Rambla online and the usual mix of "Fantastic!"/"Awful" reviews but decided to give it a go anyway, my decision based solely on the reasonable price quoted for a 5 night stay. Arriival? Excellent. Friendly staff and a smooth quick check-in process, no wasted time for anyone keen to spend time out and about in Barcelona rather than in the reception of a hotel. Room? I booked a standard twin. Clean, comfortable beds, adequate spotless bathroom and shower. room had a safe, ample storage and a balcony opening out to a great view down on La Rambla (Was this really a standard room?!) Breakfast? I booked breakfast everyday to fill up with a reasonably priced meal first thing of the day. Breakfast room was spotless.
