Buffett selection included several cereals, yoghurts, rolls, sliced bread (white and wholemeal) with a toasting option, various meats, cheese, jams, honey, 5 different fruit juices, coissants, fruit patries, cakes, coffee and tea. The breakfast staff were very pleasant, helpul and discreet. There was also a generous supply of complimentary bottles of spring water in the hotel lobby for guests to pick up on their way out. When I needed directions to tourist attractions and for public transport, the reception staff gave me the answers I needed with a smile and a map. Location? It's right on La Rambla in the pavement artists' quarter, with the street entertainers section nearby. There's also bars, pavement cafes, restaurants and souvenir stalls right on the doorstep and all around with the attractive port only a short walk away. There's the Place Reial (a large popular 'eating and drinking square') only a very short distance away as is the nearest underground station that links you to all the famous attractions that are not within easy walking distance. The popular beach is about 2 miles away by foot past the marina and craft markets on the way (a regular bus is available if you don't fanct walkng) At night? La Rambla is a 24 hour buzzing street but we had no problem sleeping without ear plugs(my daughter's a light sleeper). There's a peep show 3 doors from the hotel lit up like Disneyland at night but you wouldn't know it from the hotel. There's 2 or 3 African hookers hanging around outside (not right outside the hotel) but a poilte 'no' acts like a puff of insect repellant and amongst the lights and vibrant atmosphere of La Rambla, they're not as seedy an addition to the mix as some might like to think they are. General - Barcelona is a fascinating city blending the old magnificence of the gothic palaces and religious sites with the archtecture of Gaudi, the buzz of a 21st century port, marina, and there's curio shops, souvenir and clothing boutiques down every little narrow street (there's hundreds to choose from). The La Rambla indoor fruit/veg/fish/meat market is visibly stunning in itself and well worth a visit. there's street music everywhere and be sure to watch the entertainment when the police appear anywhere near the activity of the african street-peddlars. There's african peddlars everywhere you look with their merchandise (fake designers gear of every description) laid out on sheets on the ground with cords attatched so that they can be gathered up and removed in a split second. When the police arrive (and there's plenty of them all over the city), just watch the peddlars scatters in every direction, disappearing in a puff of smoke. It's the same on the beach where the sound of the crashing of the waves competes with the calls of the plentiful beach-sellers peddling beer, coconut slices, beach silks, sunglasses, massages and henna tattoos. One sniff of the poices and they run off in a wave, squawking and flapping down the beach like a flock of panicked overweight seagulls. Back to the hotel, it's attractive, clean, modern decor lobby and dining room, there's an attatched bar and tapas restaurant, no complaints of note, no horror stories, well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the worst I've ever been to!”
Reviews.Author: bee_africa
Reviews.Content: In July of 2009 we stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, having prepaid for the entire stay. The price was absurdly expensive (80€/night) for what the hotel had to offer; and that was: a tiny room with 2 beds meant, I suppose, for soldiers, only a small window with a view to the emergency exit escalators and an air conditioning system that needed about an hour to start functioning after turning it on. Add that to the fact that the room had a terrible smell each time you entered, after an all day walk. No mini-fridge, no mirror, not even a small table – just two chairs! The staff was quite friendly until we started complaining, asking for a better room, which of course we didn’t get, since we had already paid for our entire stay. Important: don’t let Internet photos full you; the actual rooms have nothing to do with those photos! All in all, I don’t think I’ve ever stayed at a worse place and I would definitely not recommend it to anyone. I am sure there are other hotels near La Rambla – if you really want to stay there, with a better price and better services.

Reviews.Title: “HOUSEKEEPING STOLE $70 BOTTLE OF PERFUME”
Reviews.Author: mellgirl5
Reviews.Content: Brand new $70 bottle of perfume stolen the first night of my stay. Thank goodness all other valuables were stored in the in-room safe (have never had anything stolen in all my years of travel). Paid for a superior room - was given a TINY room with hard, twin beds (worse than dorm room beds). Our view was of a brick wall ~15' away. Positives: Free WiFi. Room was clean and the bathroom was amply sized with a nice shower. Location was great on Las Ramblas (if you want to be directly on that major, heavily trafficked street. The desk staff was reasonably friendly but somewhat indifferent towards my perfume issue.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: cailinasgaillimh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend on a weekend to Barcelona, we had a lovely stay, Hotel is basic but lovely, would def stay again, now my Daughter wants me to bring her!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: rosebudmi
Reviews.Content: One word of caution...pay for a room with a balcony overlooking La Ramblas! This will get you into the newest portion of the hotel. AND it's worth the little bit of extra money to have access to the activities going on below. My husband and I visited Barcelona previously and stayed at another hotel just down the street and had planned on staying there again on this trip; however, they were full, so I had to find other accommodations. After reading some of the reviews, I was a bit nervous about making reservations pre-cruise and post-cruise, but thankfully I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The service/staff was excellent and the location is great! Lots of restaurants and cafes are available, but it's also close to the marina and major Barcelona attractions are just a short walk or cab ride away. You can also rent bicycles if you wish just down the street. And it's close to the market which is one of our favorite ways to experience Barcelona. I have been disturbed by some of the reviews regarding this hotel, but I must say my experience was very positive, and we would definitely stay at this hotel again! In fact, I may get the chance in October 2009. I highly recommend this hotel, and when we were there, they were outfitting the older rooms with new mattresses. I must tell everyone though that the mattresses are very firm, but I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: will04
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, staff polite, rooms spacious, we had one with a balcony which i recomend! the hotel could not be in a better location!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location. PaperThin Walls!”
Reviews.Author: TurkLoves2Travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights in the hotel from 24th January 2009. Location is good. At one end of the La Rambla. Clean and decent hotel. Room is new/clean but small. The single bed is so light, that it glides along the floor when you turn at night! Can even move it with one finger! The walls are thin. You can hear everything going on outside the room. From the airwells you can hear people chatting, people brushing their teeth, showering. Basically everything. The room is warm - only the aircondition(hot air works). So youd have to open the window and hear the noise as mentioned above. Breakfast: Cereal and bread, milk/coffee/tea.Yogurt etc. The bread is sooooo dry. But nevertheless still an acceptable breakfast. Would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jenlanc4
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel right in the centre of the city and ideal for seeing the main sites of Barcelona. 2 min walk to the metro station. We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights - the staff were very friendly and spoke English and the room was lovely - we had a superior room with balcony with a view over La Rambla and it wasn't too much more expensive than the standard room. definately worth having the balcony with the view over the street and the balcony doors are completely sound proof. check in is meant to be 2pm but we got there at 12pm and they were fine letting us check in. Overall a fabulous hotel and would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “This is nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mandy-in-London
Reviews.Content: We just got back from here. We stayed from 30 December 2008 to 2 January 2009. Perhaps the hotel has changed a lot since the other reviews were written but I was dreading going there after reading what is written on here. These are our findings: Check in/Reception Perfectly nice and polite staff The reception area is clean and contrary to other reviews does not smell of drains The room We had a room on the 4th floor facing the back of the hotel. It was a good size with a balcony. The room had nice decor and was light because of the two large windows. A safe is provided in the wardrobe. The bed was rock hard and the pillows were not what you could describe as plump! Bathroom The bathroom was clean and had a good, powerful shower. The towels were slightly thin but perfectly acceptable. Noise We experienced a little bit of noise on thefirst night but none thereafter. The noise came from groups of drunken English speaking men on the street. Drunken Brits abroad - Spaniards must love us. Breakfast You can pay 10 Euros to have a set breakfast in the hotel. This consists of bacon, eggs, toast, orange juice and tea/coffee. However the breakfast room is also a cafe which is open to the public so you can actually have what you want. There are a lot of places to eat on La Rambla anyway. Safety The hotel is perfectly clean, safe and secure. There is a sex shop a couple of doors down and 'ladies of the night' do congregate around there but the position of this shop is further down La Rambla than you would probably would be walking down so you would probably not need to walk past it at night. It is no worse than Soho in London. Location of the hotel It is right on La Rambla towards the bottom end. This is right in the heart of the most touristy area. Think Leicester Square in London. Yes it is busy and yes there are street performers lining each side of the street. However it is easy to get from the hotel to most of the places of interest and the closest metro station to the hotel is about a 2 minute walk away. Overall for a 2* hotel I found this one above average. It is clean, safe, with pleasant staff and is in a very central location. We booked through last minute.com and got 3 nights with return flights form Gatwick for 2 people for 700 pounds sterling. At New Year. Value-wise I think this was fine. Thankfully the reviews I read prior to traveling to Barcelona were nothing like my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok for the price we payed”
Reviews.Author: ian480
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights Oct 10th/14th to do the 2 day international walks of Barcelona. We payed for a basic room and that is what we got. No daylight in the room but as we only slept in the room this was ok. Yes the La Rambla is a 24 hour street. We left the hotel at 5-30 on both sat/sun mornings it was very busy. I also was pickpocketed on the underground and yes they are very good.I was just one of many on the same day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Strebor1984
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in Nov and paid £150 for a superior room. Could find no faults with this hotel, recpetion staff were friendly, helpful and spoke good english. The room we stayed in was clean and nicely decorated, we had a balcony which opened onto la rambla and the room also had the use of a free safe. We could not hear much noise from outside and yes there is a sex shop a few doors down but there are a few of these down la ramblas anyway. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend to others, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located but noisy and old”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug0808
Reviews.Content: Great La Rambla location. But along with that comes noise all night long. We were on the 3rd floor with a balcony, which was fun and entertaining during the evening. But being on La Rambla means you get to hear what goes on all night long. One thing not mentioned, is that the hotel is 2 doors away from a Peep Show/Adult store. We had to take an early morning flight and got up at 4:30am to hookers all around. Made us wonder who used our beds before we got there... Lobby is beautiful. Staff was friendly. But the room was decorated in the '70's probably and not remodeled since. Bed felt like it was stuffed with straw or horsehair. I think the sofas in the halls would make for a more comfortable night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy room with no view”
Reviews.Author: andostraveltheworld
Reviews.Content: The main issue with this hotel is the varying quality of room, unfortunately our room was absolutely horrible and in no way worth the 140 Euro that we paid. The hotel lobby and foyer are very nice, as are the pictures on the website, but these pictures are deceptive, the room was old, small and dark. It seems that some of the rooms are nice, but there is no indcation when you book online which standard of room you will get. We are pretty easy going and not fussy, in fact most of our travels we stay in youth hostel private doubles, but because we were unwell we decided to recuperate in a hotel. The room was of a lesser quality than many of the hostels we have recently stayed in and we were told that it was the last available room and that we could not swap. This is a good lesson about booking online. Although I would have to say we are fairly discerning when it comes to online bookings and so in this case it was a blatent misrepresentation. We used 'easy to book, online reservations', I think they also have an obligation to research the properties to ensure true representation of ALL rooms not just a priveledged few.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: UKBiker
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel!! A two star that should be a three star!! We stayed for three nights on a mid-week city break & the only issue was a flickering light which was sorted within 24hrs of mentioning it. As other people have mentioned, do not believe the bad reviews - it is perfect for travelling couples who need a decent room as a base. I have already recommended this hotel & as I work in Customer Services it made a real impression with me - & that takes some doing!!

Reviews.Title: “heart of the ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Manianka
Reviews.Content: thisis basic 3 star hotel with all you need in August in Barcelona- a bed and air conditioning :) it is located on the bottom of la rambla with easy access to the beach, and the city centre. air con worked perfeclty, room had no window, but you don't go to barcelona to stare out the window. a short 2 minute walk and you are in the lovely square- Placa Reial with a brilliant short Flamenco show at the "Tarantos"- €6 for an hour ... If you want to experience flamenco, but don't fancy a 3 hour show - this is for you. also -be sure too hire a bike!! see the whole city in 3 days cycling through quiet back roads stopping off for the odd sangria on the way. ( great place to rent on - C. Tallers, just before the Placa la catalunya €12for a full day, good condition bikes). as to the hotel clean, modern, basic , working air con, CENTRAL CENTRAL CENTRAL) what more to ask for for €300 for 4 nights for 2. Definately good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great little pearl”
Reviews.Author: ACIsrael
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for about a week. It was going through renovation at the time. The staff made sure that the noise won't bother me and even moved me to another room (a double room, even though I booked and payed for a single one), to make sure I'm not bothered by the noise. The staff was great. The location's amazing - right on La Ramblas. Close to the tube station, the beach and Barry Gothic. Lots of restaurants and shops nearby. Rooms are really big (not only when compared to the European standard). Bath is clean, so are the sheets etc. Great stay, great value. The area feels pretty safe, though I wouldn't recommend walking in the little Barcelona alleys in general, especially for solo travelers like myself (nothing to do with the hotel, just a word of general advice).

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL - STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: Salli03
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: My daughter (4yrs old) and I arrived at the hotel on the 23rd June. I didn't realise until the taxi pulled outside the hotel that there was a SEX SHOP next door. ROOM: my daughter cried when walked into the room. It was dark dingy and smelt like an open sewer. absolute waste of money. STAFF: The staff were rude and obnoxious and unhelpful.( They wouldn't assist us with our suitcases to our rooms) ADVICE: should book a hotel walking distance from the Ramblas or even an apartment. Which is much better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: no-moaner
Reviews.Content: I really don't understand people who complain about this hotel. It's great. Friendly staff, incredibly clean rooms, TERRIFIC location (right in La Rambla, 20-25 minutes' walk and you are on the beach). Has everything you need. Besides, when in Barcelona, you are not really going to sit indoors, are you? Even though it has **, feels like **** in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and great location”
Reviews.Author: 1hillj
Reviews.Content: I treated my boyfriend to a trip to Baca. We had never been before, and after i booked the hotel i was very worried after reading these reviews, i wold just like to say that if you just need a place to sleep and shower well it is fine. It was veryc lean. I do admit we did have to change the room, but only because the plug in the bath was stuck, nothing serious. The staff were willing to help. The taxi's were on strike coming home and they sorted all transfers out for us, they really went out of their way for us. I admit the room was small but not a problem for a few nights. It was clean and friendly, yeah it isnt the Ritz but what more do you want from a cheap hotel on one a the most famous streets in the world. Anyone who books this hotel dont worry about these reviews unless you are use to luxury. I stayed three nights 10th of june till the 13th and will deffo be returning.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel arc la rambla”
Reviews.Author: razor_ray50
Reviews.Content: the location for this hotel is perfect right on la rambla ,metro few hundred yards tourist buses same distance at top of la rambla .a must for this hotel is to pay a little extra for room 20 euros per day overlooking la rambla with small balcony to see the world go by do not believe some reviews that it is noisy on front just shut balcony doors and turn on air conditioning. hotel receptionists very knowledgeable and friendly but move off la rambla for drinks (very expensive) plenty of tapas bars and also restaurants within a few hundred yards prices on writing this review 10/06/2008 pint of beer between 4 and 5 euros, tapas 6 to 7 euros. wine varied dear 16euros rose' wine on la rambla down to 4 euros in side streets if going to see nou camp stadium go to catalunya metro at top of la rambla get green line number 3 and go to end of line the university its a 5 minute walk when you get off. hope this review is of help to you. i have photos from balcony showing view if anybody would like to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “NOT RECOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: sullytuk
Reviews.Content: I am not one too complain or write reviews - until now that is. We booked this hotel online knowing it was only two star the pictures they publish is far from what we got! The loby and stair case is all that resembled the advert! We were put on the 5th floor and the lift only went too the 4th floor ( apparently the one lift that goes to the top was out of order) as too was the WIFI and the airconditioning did not work - according to the reception they switch the cooling off in the winter because it is not needed but the room was hot as hell and th window opened up on to a shaft which did not let any air in apart from the airoma of Sewer (according to reception the whole of Barcelona smells like this). The Bed was as hard as the floor and had a horse blanket on it which looked well used. Room was tiny with no bin. Our friends were on a different floor and thier room was worse than ours!! we checked out first thing in the morning and front desk was not happy. We got a 3 star hotel for less further up the La Rambla called Hotel Turin and they where Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Arc is OK !”
Reviews.Author: emandem
Reviews.Content: just back from barcelona weekend. Stayed in arc la rambla at 19 La Rambla, booked through booking.com - 'superior twin'. Very nice room, quite simple, very clean. Fab location, five minutes from metro, marina, palau guell, barri gotic, short walk to paral.lel for funicular and cable car trip up montjuic and Miro gallery. Bit noisy from an all night beer kiosk in the alley way at the side of the hotel - recommend ear plugs! We paid 350 euro for three nights and didn't try the breakfast as we like exploring all the little cafes around the area which are great. enjoy your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Remember !! 2 Euro Coins for Luggage Storage Each Time Y ou Open It”
Reviews.Author: justusnow
Reviews.Content: This was Great. I mean Great!!!!! Hotel right on the Las Ramblas. Our Room was in the front. had a small Romeo and Juliet balcony . Doors swung open and you could step out see everything all day and all night long. It was soooo cool. It was not noisy. Just the sound s of people outside cleaning, laughter and light city sounds. Kind of quiet actually. The hotel like the area has character and was not built in 2008, but probably in the 1940's or earlier. Therefore, It was not new and it was not large. It is nestled among the buildings and businesses that are common to most older areas around the world. There is something for everybody. ---and everybody was there. If you arrive early you can store your luggage in locked cabinets. However, if you have to return to open them you have to pay all over again. 2 Euros each time. So bring a lot of 2 euro coins just in case the desk runs out. The people at the desk, restaurant and cleaning staff are very kind . Speak slowly. they did not always understand what was said spoken quickly. The hotel is safe and clean. Hotel Arc La Rambla has character and offers the basic things that new large hotels have only on a small scale. It's okay for kids to stay. It's just not enough space for them to run wild. Everything is accessible from the hotel. tours can be booked etc. Mcdonalds , Burger King and high end eating and high end shopping(Plaza Catalonia) very close by. This is a diamond in the rough if there ever was one. I thought it was going to be bad or something. It was fabulous for the price and the experience as as tourist of old downtown Barcelona. I am going back there on my next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location shame about the rest”
Reviews.Author: ScottyIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights from 17th March 2008 - on arrival (late) we were greeted by someone with little or no English and when we checked our room found it was a standard and not a superior as we had booked - after some arguments we were told we had to stay in the room and it would be sorted in the morning - we were offered two days breakfasts complimentary to make up for the difference. The superior room was smaller than the standard and the extra amount we paid for a view with a balcony over las ramblas wasn't really worth it. The breakfast is paltry with hard miniature pastries, cheap fruit juices and a couple of trays of ham and cheese with three options for cereal. hardly worth the 10 euro each. The hotel does look like they've tried to make some upgrades but it still comes off more like a hostel, they have some problems with sewage odours in the central areas which needs addressing and there was some building work going on on the ground floor. By the way they say they have a left luggage area - they don't - they have lockers on the ground floor which you have to pay for. No different than a railway station.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: polly17024
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't be better, straight out onto La Rambla and easy walking distance down to the harbour. Hotel is very clean. The room was small and basic but adequate for our two night stay. It was at the back of the hotel and had no view whatsoever. Although the bathroom is clean there is smell of drains and no shower curtain. You need to take your own toiletries. Breakfast is basic continental and not really worth 10 euros, there are plenty of eating places round about. We found the receptionists helpful. Barcelona is fabulous and two nights was not enough! Will definitely return to the city but probably not to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: roadrunner09
Reviews.Content: First impression on walking into the hotel was good. Clean and bright reception area. Staff polite. However the room on the second floor we were given was very disappointing. Very dark and dingy. No windows. No view. Couldn't read in bed as no bedside lights. Bathroom window broken, shower broken, toilet not working properly. Workmen next door drilling and hammering from 9am in the morning until 10.30 pm at night. Breakfasts were good and there was a safe in the bedroom which we used. Next time I shall pay more and stay in a three/four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: seandoyleqpr
Reviews.Content: Booked a double room and we got a twin one. When we asked to chane they refused. I dont know if it was the time of year or a recent problem but the entire hotel and especially our room absolutly stunk of sewage. Really gross. You can tell that half the hotel has been done up and half hasnt but it really was an unsavoury experience. The staff there are some of the rudest people I have met aswell, but to be honest we only met possibly two nice spanish people when over there. The rest were all very impolite. To sum up, we booked in for two nights, had most of our money stolen, was disgusted with the city (unsafe and riddled with thiefs) and the hotel and returned home within 24 hours of arrival

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kemomom
Reviews.Content: Visited barcelona for the second time for 7 nights . great time of the year except for sudden closings of trains, museums and other attractions due to the season. Did catch the Three kings festivities and the biggest sales of the year. The hotel was great a 2 star with some boutique rooms ,4 star sheets. And plenty of very hot and high pressure showers. the only negative was the night time noise at our superior balcony room on the 2nd floor (room 218) The balcony faced the alley between la Rambla and El Raval. ( no view except the first floor roof and apartment dwellers balconies) After midnight groups would congregate before ,during and after the closing of the clubs in the alleys and ther was no way of drowning out the noise except for earplugs and closed door to the balcony. So from trash pickup til 6am it was quite livly every night. Maybe during hotter or colder weather the ac/heater fan noise would take care of most of it but it was too warm to sleep with the heat and it did not have a fan only setting. But it was our choice not to chnge rooms when they became available after 2 nights . The offer was made. Other friends were at 4 stars that did not compare with our great room and location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room”
Reviews.Author: anon003
Reviews.Content: The room was extremely clean, modern and had all the facilities we required. There was a balcony looking straight out on to La Ramblas and we were right in the centre of everything. we could not have hoped for a better location. The staff were extremely helpful and polite. The only thing i would advise is to bring your own hairdryer. I would most definatly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WinemerchantPoole
Reviews.Content: Hotel was just fine,good staff,clean modern rooms,free safe,small balcony overlooking the ramblas,at a great price. Just across the road on Escudellers is La Fonda restaurant,you have to queue,but good food,nice ambience and cheap as chips. If you like tapas you must try the Chipirones(baby squid) at El Quim in the Boqueria just up from the hotel,they are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: UkYoungcouple
Reviews.Content: Very concerned before we traveled due to the poor reviews but I was pleasantly surprised. An excellent location despite some reviews making mention of the dodgy area we had no complaints. Yes there is a sex shop nearby but it didn't impact on our stay at all. I never felt uneasy at all although we didn't stay out much past midnight. The lobby of the hotel was very impressive and we had to double check our booking slip to make sure we had come to the right hotel. The room was modern and clean with a nice view onto la ramblas. The doors to the balcony were doubled glazed and when shut you could hear nothing from the road, which is useful as when open it is very noisy. The bathroom was excellent and clean with a huge shower and nice hot water. Only complaint was the fact that we were given 2 single beds instead of a double, although to be fair to the hotel we didn't ask to change rooms or anything so they may well have been amenable. It would have been nice to have had a fridge in the room but you were so close to the bars/restaurants it was just as easy to run downstairs to get a drink or a snack. I would definitely recommend this hotel - however we did book a superior room so whether this has a significant impact on the quality (compared to some of the other reviews) I do not know. Overall an excellent experience

Reviews.Title: “not a nice place”
Reviews.Author: bettyboop67
Reviews.Content: a group of us stayed here for 3 nights when we arrived and got booked into our rooms 2 of therooms at the front of the hotel on the 3rd floor were dirty and smelly we complained and they said that there was no more available until the next day so the next morning we were moved to just ok of rooms they were not the rooms that we seen on the internet and the staff were not the friendliest of people would not stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: MJAMSA1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned yesterday from our European vacation and Arc la Rambla was the last hotel we stayed in. I was very nervous about staying there after reading previous reviews and debated what I would take as a result of the thefts. But I was pleased to find a very modern lobby and helpful staff. Our room was pleasantly large and had a safe which we used for free. The room was very clean and the location could not be beat. I would definitely stay there again. We even felt that it was the best hotel we had stayed in during our whole trip. I only suggest that you take what you need and avoid taking too many valuables that may not fit in the small safe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: mactoolsix
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights - great location. The hotel had some very recent remodeling going on, as many halllways were just painted. The only negative, was the room desperately lacked anywhere to put anything. No tables or dressers. Even the bathroom (large) had no place to put anything. The shower head was slightly dirty. We would consider using this hotel again. Because of recent posts, we did take precautions to lock up our valuables in the closet using a luggage lock.

Reviews.Title: “Could not be better”
Reviews.Author: jovine
Reviews.Content: I had read some terrible reviews on this hotel and began to wonder what I had let myself in for. On arrival, we were allocated a superior room, as there was some problem with an ordinary one and told we may have to change rooms the following day. We were able to keep the same room anyway. Our room was on the third floor. Very clean and bright with a balcony overlooking La Rambla. It was wonderful watching the world go by. The bathroom was excellent. Breakfast was all you would expect, croissants, fruit, cheese, ham, toast, yoghurts, fruit juice, tea, coffee. Cannot understand why people have complained in the past. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Would highly recommend as we thought we may be staying in the wrong place having read all the negative reviews. Excellent value for money - maybe some people just expect too much or thrive on complaining.............!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely no complaints”
Reviews.Author: eclark73
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews, we were a bit weary about this hotel. It turned out to be an excellent base for our three night stop. What valuables we did have (passports, cash etc) was stored in the reception safe and always available. Staff were friendly enough, but the main attraction is this hotel's location right on the bustling las ramblas. If it's a quiet place you're after don't book here, but if it's a clean budget hotel right in the heart of things, we would absolutely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but once was enough”
Reviews.Author: Hawk63
Reviews.Content: We weren't robbed and our room was spotlessly clean although very small. There was no safe. The room included a sliding glass door which we could not lock but which wouldn't open more than 2 inches either. The staff were professional. friendly, and helpful. The ground floor has recently been modernized and looks lovely but smells like cat pee. The location is wonderful! We paid 75 euros per night and were given a continental breakfast on our first morning for free. The second morning we left at 6am, too early for such an amenity.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever......”
Reviews.Author: Rain1438
Reviews.Content: I Checked into Hotel thinking that it was really nice considering it was only 2 stars....well was i mistaken.....I Left the room for about 1 hour only to return and find my knapsack was gone....my knapsack carried a laptop, clothing, expensive makeup and sunglassed, cell phone chargers, memory cards for my camera....I felt very violated...This hotel has a policy to leave your ghetto old fashioned key at the front desk when ever your leave your hotel room....well the staff then takes your key and robs your room...this experience totally ruined my vacation and I would never ever go back to Barcelona or this hotel again......I already heard about all the purse snatchings but i never in a million years would think that someone would actually go in my room and rob me and to make matters worse it was an employee of the hotel...They were no help at all and they sat there and smirked the whole time I was crying and upset and trying to get to the bottom of what happened. They called the police and told me the police would not come...then i called the police on my own and they said the hotel staff told them not to come to me..but they made it there about 5 minutes after my phone call...(the police station is a block away from hotel)..If you want to keep your belongings and your rights do not stay at this hotel trust me....You will make a mistake of your life to trust these arogant people...The employees of the hotel were very rude...no help at all when it came to anything...PLUS they have a on site security guard that basically walked away when he heard my bag was gone...and was never seen again that day....what is the point of having security....They twisted the story to the police man....Then i asked them to check the cameras to see who walked out with my bag and the employees of the hotel said they need a permit to check the cameras and the only one who has the permit is the Owner...which the Owner does not live in Barcelona....How convienient is that??

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: canucktravler
Reviews.Content: I know that the problem of HOTEL THEFT was mentioned in a previous email, but I am going to go into a bit more detail. My family and I checked into the hotel in March for a few nights. We were told upon checking in that we should leave our key at the front desk whenever we left the hotel. They said this measure was to prevent us from losing it while out, but I soon realized it was their way of determining whether or not you were in your room. As soon as we checked in, we headed out for a quick lunch. An hour later, we returned to find our $2000 brand new laptop had been stolen right out of our locked room! The laptop bag also contained many other valuable items, none of which would fit in the safe. We made the wrong assumption that it was safe to leave items in our hotel room. We immediately informed the staff. A young guy who worked at the front desk had a knowing smirk on his face the entire time, which lead us to believe that he was involved. When we checked in we walked up to our room and there was NO ONE anywhere around....so who else could have known we had a laptop in that particular room besides the hotel staff? The manager was being completely unhelpful and simply shrugged his shoulders as if to say, "these things happen." I asked him to call the police. He said there would be no point since they would not show up anyway. I told him to call anyway. Once on the line, he told the police officer not to come in Spanish. He then put me on the line and the officer, who spoke english well, told me that he was told NOT to come by the manager, but that he was going to come anyway. We spent the rest of our holiday filling out police reports and being treated like crap by the staff - they evidently did not like having a finger pointed at them by myself or the police, or decided that there was no sign of forced entry into our room, and that a key had obviously been used. The worst part of all was that there was a video camera pointed at the front door. The staff claimed that they were not able to access its contents - only the owner of the hotel could do that...and he conveniently did not live in Barcelona. I understand that we will never get the laptop back, or all of the files and pictures of holidays that we had stored on it, but to have to worry about theft in your hotel room is just unacceptable. I have left more important items in hotels in third world countries without a problem. What does that say?

Reviews.Title: “OK but book a premier room..”
Reviews.Author: ScubyDoo
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 2 night stay in Barcelona.. The hotel is well positioned in La Rambla and ok for a couple of nights.. The hotel reception and premier rooms are very modern and ok, but venture to other parts of the hotel and it looks like a run down sea side guest house.. Considering that they are trying to achieve an upgrade to a 3 star, I found the staff a little unfriendly at times.. We booked what we thought was B&B, but on paying it was added as an extra ( it was quite an nice continental breakfast though) so please check on arrival if its included. The only thing that really upset us was when we left, the hotel booked a taxi for us to the airport and we ended up paying €39 which was double that what we payed on the way to the hotel..all the other taxis we used also were very cheap when called from the street and quite accessable.. so we really didn't need to book..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Gem_84_23
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the horror stories in previous reviews I was dreading my stay at the Arc La Rambla however, I could never have been more surprised. On arrival at the hotel we were greeted by the very friendly staff in the elegant recently refurbished reception area. On check-in we were told that the standard rooms we had booked had been upgraded to superior rooms free of charge which was an added bonus! The rooms are basic but considering the hotel is 2* you get a TV, powershower and both the room and ensuite are both immaculately clean. I could not fault it. We had a small balcony looking out onto The Ramblas which was good for watching people go by. Even though we were right on the front the double glazed windows were just enough to keep the noise to a minimum. Yes it is true... there is a sex shop next door and a peep show next to that however we did not see or hear anything that we did not want to - it was all very discreet. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to the Port 'Vell' if you turn right out of the hotel and a 10 minute walk to Catalunya Square if you turn left out of the hotel were you can catch the Red & Blue line sightseeing tour buses (2 day ticket costs 23 euros and takes you to the likes of the Nou Camp, Sacred Family Church, Cathedral, beach etc etc) Breakfast is available at the hotel but to be honest there is more choice and better value out and about. Also if you like a drink then venture into the square behind the Ramblas as a glass of beer on the strip ranges between 7-10 euros whereas in the adjacent streets / square a beer only cost 3 euros. I would recommend 'Mikel Etxea' (midway up the ramblas on the left)for breakfast especially if Benito is working! Check out is at 12pm however if you are flying later in the afternoon there are lockers at the rear of the ground floor of the hotel for 2 euros were you can store your suitcases (two small or one large) until your flight. Shuttle bus to and from the airport is 3.80 Euros and you are picked up and dropped off in Catalunya square however there were four of us and it only cost 30 for a taxi which drops you right outside the hotel. If you want a very very reasonable hotel right in the centre of Barcelona then you will have to part with some of the creature comforts however, I thought the hotel was superb value for money and would recommend it to travellers coming to Barcelona for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “happily surprised”
Reviews.Author: maggieFyldeCoast
Reviews.Content: Before staying at the hotel i read negative reviews, i was somewhat apprehensive ..however on arriving, the reception was modern and clean, the staff polite. I was impressed with the size of the room & bathroom and again, modern & clean. Admittedly we were staying at the back of the hotel and therefore didn't hear any noise. However, I would have loved a room at the front of the hotel with a balcony......your staying in a cosmopolitain city - I would expect noise and this would be a great way to watch the city go by. I felt secure in the hotel, you could leave valuables in the hotel safe. I didn't eat in the hotel so can not comment on the food. A kettle in the room for tea/coffee would have been handy. I would go back to stay, great location.

Reviews.Title: “We had our things STOLEN in our room”
Reviews.Author: lostintranslation17
Reviews.Content: The hotel was aweful, the room door a joke. We had merely arrived and left the hotel room for only one hour to have diner. When we got back, somebody had broken into our room (307) and had stolen our camera, phone, mp3 player, among other things. AVOID THIS HOTEL, even if it is the last available room in the whole of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget”
Reviews.Author: DaveSKeighley
Reviews.Content: Ok reading the reviews I had no idea what to expect but come on folks this is not a bad hotel. The entrance, smart polished marble, the reception staff I met were very helpful. The lifts worked and the room (the basic double) was clean and tidy although I have to say the bright avacado coloured bathroom suite took a bit of getting used to. It's plus and minus is it's central location. Near the bottom of the Ramblas and at the front as I was there was some noise. However double glazed double doors inside the shutters kept that down to a minimum. At the far end of reception, away from the entrance, a set of luggage lockers are provided which will fit a large suitcase for 2 euros. I think this is better than dumping the bags in a room which nobody supervises.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, well located on Rambla”
Reviews.Author: hmose
Reviews.Content: Much better than expected from reading earlier reviews. They couldn't make good on the wifi though, which I had counted on. Had a great room overlooking La Rambla, and the 4th floor not so noisy.
